Name: Ailayer
Description: An EVM-compatible Bitcoin Layer 2 that uses inscriptions as gas. It also incorporates AI-driven modular architecture, leveraging mining incentives to manage a shared AI training.

Name: Alpen Labs
Description: Alpen Labs is developing Strata, a Bitcoin Layer 2 ZK-rollup that enables scalable payments, lending, stablecoins, and smart contracts with enhanced privacy and programmability. Built with zero-knowledge technology, Strata aims to bring full DeFi functionality to Bitcoin while maintaining privacy and security. The protocol supports complex financial operations like lending, borrowing, and yield farming directly on Bitcoin, expanding its utility beyond simple value transfer.

Name: Ark
Description: Ark is a groundbreaking Bitcoin Layer 2 solution that enables instant, private Bitcoin payments through virtual UTXOs without requiring on-chain transactions or Lightning channels. By creating a virtual UTXO system, Ark allows users to send Bitcoin instantly and privately while maintaining full Bitcoin security. The protocol eliminates the need for channel management, routing complexity, and on-chain fees, making Bitcoin payments as simple as traditional digital payments while preserving Bitcoin's core properties.

Name: B² Network
Description: B² Network is an EVM-compatible Bitcoin Layer 2 solution using zero-knowledge rollup technology. It features B² Rollup for smart contracts and B² Hub as Bitcoin's data availability layer, achieving high scalability while maintaining Bitcoin's security.

Name: BEVM
Description: BEVM is the first fully decentralized Bitcoin Layer 2 that is EVM-compatible and uses BTC as gas. It enables Ethereum ecosystem DApps to operate on Bitcoin L2, offering cross-chain interaction, data integrity assurance, decentralized processing, and advanced scalability.

Name: Bitfinity
Description: Bitfinity Network is a Bitcoin Layer 2 solution that integrates Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) compatibility into the Bitcoin ecosystem. It enables developers to deploy Solidity-based smart contracts and decentralized applications on Bitcoin, significantly expanding its functionality beyond traditional transactions.

Name: Bison
Description: Bison Network is a sovereign rollup using ZK-STARK technology with Bitcoin as its data availability layer. It enables EVM-compatible smart contracts and achieves up to 2,200 TPS with significantly lower fees than Bitcoin.

Name: BitLayer
Description: BitLayer is a Bitcoin Layer 2 network based on BitVM, supporting multiple virtual machines and EVM compatibility for enhanced Bitcoin scalability and smart contract functionality.

Name: bitSmiley
Description: bitSmiley is a Bitcoin DeFi protocol offering bitUSD stablecoin, bitLending platform, and derivatives. It enables over-collateralized stablecoin minting using Bitcoin as collateral with peer-to-peer lending capabilities.

Name: BOB
Description: BOB is a hybrid chain gateway to Bitcoin DeFi, combining Bitcoin security with EVM compatibility. It offers 1-click Bitcoin DeFi access, hybrid vaults for cross-chain yield, and trustless BTC deposits powered by BitVM and ZK-proofs.

Name: Bool Network
Description: Bool Network is a decentralized Bitcoin verification layer using Dynamic Hidden Committees and Taproot technology. It enables cross-chain asset transfers and Bitcoin DeFi integration while maintaining self-custody.

Name: Botanix
Description: Botanix Labs is developing Spiderchain, a fully decentralized EVM-equivalent Layer 2 solution for Bitcoin with enhanced scalability and smart contract capabilities.

Name: Citrea
Description: Citrea is a Bitcoin Layer 2 ZK-rollup that brings Ethereum-compatible smart contracts to Bitcoin while maintaining Bitcoin's security guarantees. Built on the CitreaVM, it enables developers to deploy Solidity contracts and build DeFi applications on Bitcoin using cBTC as the native token. Citrea uses zero-knowledge proofs to ensure transaction validity while leveraging Bitcoin as the data availability layer, providing both scalability and security for Bitcoin-based smart contract applications.

Name: Lightning Network
Description: The Lightning Network is Bitcoin's premier Layer 2 scaling solution, enabling instant, low-cost micropayments through off-chain payment channels. As the first and most established Bitcoin L2, it processes millions of transactions daily with sub-second settlement times and minimal fees. The network uses bidirectional payment channels and multi-hop routing to enable scalable Bitcoin payments while maintaining the security and decentralization of the base layer.

Name: Liquid Network
Description: The Liquid Network is an open-source Bitcoin sidechain and layer-2 solution interoperable with Lightning that enables faster, more confidential bitcoin transactions and the issuance and exchange of digital assets like stablecoins, tokenized securities, and bonds.

Name: LumiBit
Description: LumiBit is a Bitcoin Layer 2 ZK-rollup with ZK-EVM technology, offering full EVM compatibility for Ethereum smart contract migration. It uses Bitcoin as a data availability layer with universal circuit design and efficient transaction verification.

Name: Map Protocol
Description: MAP Protocol is a Bitcoin Layer 2 interoperability solution utilizing ZK light client technology as a gateway for developers and users within the Bitcoin ecosystem. It enables seamless cross-chain interactions between Bitcoin and other public blockchain networks.

Name: Mercury Layer
Description: Mercury Layer is a Bitcoin statechain implementation that enables off-chain Bitcoin transfers while maintaining security through on-chain enforcement.

Name: Merlin Chain
Description: Merlin Chain is Bitcoin's largest Layer 2 with $4B+ TVL, launched January 2024. It's a ZK-rollup with EVM compatibility, hosting 200+ projects and 1.9M+ users, processing 12.7M+ transactions and supporting 80%+ of Bitcoin-native assets.

Name: Psy Protocol
Description: Psy Protocol is a privacy-preserving blockchain with PARTH architecture and Proof of Useful Work 2.0. It achieves millions of TPS with local proving for radical privacy, using Software-Defined Keys for programmable identity and AI agent support.

Name: RGB
Description: RGB is a protocol for issuing and transferring digital assets and rights on Bitcoin through customizable off-chain smart contracts. Using client-side validation, RGB keeps transaction data off-chain while relying on Bitcoin as a commitment layer to prevent double spending. This ensures greater scalability, enhanced privacy, and flexibility. RGB integrates seamlessly with Lightning Network, enabling asset-specific lightning channels and compatibility with future Bitcoin scalability solutions.

Name: Riema Labs
Description: Riema Labs is a pioneering entity in the Bitcoin ecosystem, renowned for its innovative data availability layer designed to significantly reduce transaction costs. The startup's innovative product is Nubit, the first-ever Bitcoin-native data availability layer, which leverages advanced techniques such as native staking and decentralized bridging.

Name: Rollux
Description: Rollux is Syscoin's official Layer 2 OPStack rollup that inherits Bitcoin's PoW security through merge-mining. It uses Proof-of-Data Availability (PoDA) for 2-second block times, sub-$0.01 fees, and full EVM compatibility with Sentry Node finality.

Name: Rooch Network
Description: Rooch Network is a MoveVM-based Bitcoin Layer 2 enabling Bitcoin to become programmable, scalable, and interoperable. It features non-custodial BTC staking compatible with Babylon protocol and supports 130M+ transactions with 7,500+ users.

Name: Satoshi Protocol
Description: Satoshi Protocol is the first stablecoin backed by Bitcoin, designed to foster a new era of decentralized finance by enhancing transparency and efficiency in blockchain transactions. It emphasizes secure, trustless exchanges and aims to streamline financial operations across various blockchain networks.

Name: Spark
Description: Spark is a Bitcoin statechain protocol that revolutionizes Bitcoin transfers by enabling instant, private transactions with minimal on-chain footprint. Unlike traditional Bitcoin transactions, Spark uses cryptographic proofs and statechains to allow users to transfer Bitcoin ownership off-chain while maintaining security through on-chain enforcement. This approach provides near-instant settlement, enhanced privacy, and significantly reduced transaction costs compared to on-chain Bitcoin transfers.

Name: Lnfi Network
Description: Lnfi Network is a Bitcoin Lightning Network implementation focused on providing fast, low-cost Bitcoin payments with enhanced privacy features.

Name: Lygos Finance
Description: Lygos Finance leverages Discreet Log Contracts (DLCs) to enable Bitcoin-based financial derivatives and smart contract functionality on Bitcoin.

Name: BTKN
Description: BTKN is a Bitcoin-native token standard built on the Spark protocol's LRC20 framework, enabling the creation and management of fungible tokens directly on Bitcoin. Unlike traditional token standards that require smart contracts, BTKN leverages Bitcoin's UTXO model and witness data to create tokens that are native to Bitcoin's architecture. This approach provides a more secure and Bitcoin-aligned way to issue and transfer tokens while maintaining compatibility with Bitcoin's core principles and security model.

Name: Mezo
Description: Mezo is an economic layer for Bitcoin that enables yield generation through Proof of HODL, bridging Bitcoin holders to decentralized applications.

Name: ZKM
Description: ZKM is developing a Bitcoin Layer 2 solution focusing on scalability and interoperability, incubated by Ethereum Layer 2 Metis.

Name: Midl
Description: Midl is an execution environment that brings smart contracts to Bitcoin, enabling native dApps and financial products. Unlike sidechains or Layer 2s, it provides a native execution environment for Bitcoin with seamless support for Bitcoin-native token standards.

Name: Plasma
Description: Plasma is a Bitcoin sidechain with full EVM compatibility, engineered for speed and efficiency. It serves as a high-performance settlement layer optimized for fee-free USDT transfers, cross-border payments, remittances, and DeFi services globally.

Name: Babylon
Description: Babylon is a Bitcoin staking protocol that enables non-custodial staking via Taproot time-locked scripts. Users can stake BTC to secure other blockchains while maintaining self-custody and earning rewards, all without wrapping or bridging Bitcoin.

Name: Sova
Description: Sova is the first native-Bitcoin treasury chain built on OP Superchain, enabling UTXO-aware, EVM-compatible smart contracts to interact with real BTC without wrapping or federated bridges. Designed for institutional BTC yield generation.
